 Occupation: Pharmacist.

2 M Mitchell Ross Albury

Born: 23 Jul 1963 - Nassau, New Providence, Bahamas 42 Christened: Died: Buried:

Spouse: Stella Louise Higgs Marr: 18 Apr 1987 - Spanish Wells, Bahamas

General Notes: Husband - Alfred Bates Albury

As a young man he moved to Nassau where he was employed by Cole's Pharmacy for 27 years and served as a pharmacist for many of those years. He retired in 1971 and along with his wife and two sons moved back to his home town of Spanish Wells. During the 1990's he returned to work for 3 years as a pharmacist at the Spanish Wells Food Fair Pharmacy. He became well known for his now famous boiled fish breakfast which he cooked and served to his family and a few friends every Sunday morning. This eventually grew to include politicians such as the Members of Parliament for the constituency and even Prime Minister Hon. Hubert A. Ingraham. Also many visitors to the island have enjoyed breakfast at Bates.

General Notes: Wife - Alice Maude Gates

When she was 2 years old her family moved to Nassau where she grew up and eventually married. She moved to Spanish Wells with her husband and two sons in 1971.

Medical Notes: Wife - Alice Maude Gates

Diabetic
